name: Game Boy ROM File
summary: Learn about .GB files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Gaming enthusiasts utilize emulation software to play games on their computers without the gaming console that initially played them. For example, gamers who want to relive the games they played on Game Boy in the 1980s - 90s use emulation software, such as VisualBoyAdvance, KiGB, and BGB, to emulate Game Boy game ROMs.

To get game data stored in game cartridges into a playable format, gamers dump game data from the cartridges with special hardware and software, then save the data in the GB format on their computer. They may then upload the files to share with others who can then download the GB files to play them on their computer with an emulator.

description: A GB file is a ROM image of a Nintendo Game Boy video game. It stores the complete data of a Game Boy game dumped from a game cartridge. Gamers load GB files in a Game Boy emulation program on a computer to play games without the Game Boy console.

instructions: You can open a GB file with various Game Boy emulators, including VisualBoyAdvance, BGB, RetroArch, and KiGB. For example, to open a GB file with VisualBoyAdvance, select File â†’ Open GB...
